Office of the Registrar

Commencement Information

Commencement Information

Congratulations Graduates!

Commencement is the culminating event of an academic career, perhaps as significant to family and friends as it is to the graduate. As you begin planning for this very special occasion, this page will provide you with the essential information you need to know for the recognition of your success.

April 27, 2024 Commencement

Bachelor and Associate Degrees

Saturday, April 27, 2024 - 10:00 am

8:30 am – Registration: Library Auditorium

8:30 am - Doors to McNutt Campus Center Open for guests

10:00 am - Commencement Ceremony - Cutlip Auditorium - McNutt Campus Center.

Reception: There will be a reception immediately following the Ceremonies.

Undergraduate Students

Convocation Ceremony, Ivy Ceremony, Senior Soiree. April 26, 2024 starting at 4:00 pm

Convocation starts at 4:00 pm with the Ivy Ceremony and Senior Soiree immediately following.

Registration for the Ivy Ceremony in front of the Academic Building main entrance facing Senior Lake.

Professional photographer will be on site.

Please be sure to wear your cap and gown.

Doctorate, Master and Education Specialist Degrees

Saturday, April 27, 2024 - 2:00 pm

12:30 pm – Registration: Library Auditorium

1:00 pm - Doors to McNutt Campus Center Open for guests

2:00 pm - Commencement Ceremony - Cutlip Auditorium - McNutt Campus Center

Reception: There will be a reception immediately following the Ceremonies.

Academic Policies to Participate in Commencement

The deadline to Register is April 2, 2024

Undergraduate conferrals: Undergraduate students who will have their degrees conferred in October, December 2023, March or April 2024 may participate in the April 2024 commencement ceremony.

Undergraduate June and August 2024 conferrals: Undergraduate students who will have their degrees conferred in June or August 2024 may participate in the April 2024 commencement ceremony with the approval of Academic Affairs. Students may petition to "walk short" if they are within six hours of their requirements and they register to complete the missing requirements at WWU before the end of their conferral date. (IE: A student who walks short in April 2024 must complete requirements prior to the June/August conferral date, or their conferral date will be pushed back.) They must complete the "Request To Participate In Commencement Short Credit Hours" form that is located in Owlnet. You can access that by using your Quicklaunch login, then Student Forms; or by logging into Owlnet, Student Tab; Student Forms tab.

Master and Education Specialist Conferrals: Graduate students who will have their degrees conferred in October, December 2023, March, April, June, or August 2024 may participate in the April 2024 commencement ceremony. All students who participate in the April 2024 commencement ceremony must complete requirements prior to their conferral date, or their conferral date will be pushed back.

Doctoral Students

June, August, October and December 2023 Doctoral students who have successfully defended may participate in the ceremony..

All other Doctoral Students may participate in the commencement ceremony if they successfully defend by the end of the Spring 2024 semester, April 26, 2024.

Doctoral Students must purchase regalia from Herff Jones before the April 2, 2024 deadline. Please see below - "Order your Regalia"

Doctoral students who defend after the deadline for printing Commencement Programs will not have their name in the Program.

Steps to Participte in Commencment

Register to Attend Ceremony

The deadline to register has passed.

Order your Regalia

Order your regalia through Herff Jones by April 2, 2024, at 10:59 pm, to avoid a late fee.

Orders after April 2, 2024, at 10:59 pm will be charged a two-day shipping fee and will be accepted until 10:59 pm on April 8, 2024.

Orders will not be accepted after April 8, 2024, 10:59 pm.

Printed Invitations and announcements for mailing to family and friends may be ordered from Herff Jones (see above link). All regalia must be ordered from Herff Jones. You are only required to order regalia. All other purchases from Herff Jones are voluntary.

When you receive your regalia, check it with the following list to make sure you have the correct colors, etc.:

Degree Regalia Associates Gray cap and gown with white tassel BA Black cap and gown with white tassel BAS Black cap and gown with gold tassel BFA Black cap and gown with dark brown tassel BGS Black cap and gown with white tassel BS Black cap and gown with gold tassel BSW Black cap and gown with light yellow tassel MA Black cap and gown with drab/green hood and drab brown tassel MBA Black cap and gown with drab/green hood and drab brown tassel MED Black cap and gown with blue/green hood and light blue tassel MHA Black cap and gown with Kelly Green/green hood and Kelly Green tassel EDS Black cap and gown with blue/burgundy hood and light blue tassel EDD Black tam/gold tassel, black gown/blue chevrons and front plaque, black hood blue/green bands

If you receive incorrect regalia, please call Herff Jones Customer Service at 800.837.4235.

Legacy Stoles (Optional)

Honor your William Woods family tradition with a commemorative graduation stole. The stole is designed so names can be added as future generations of your family graduate from The Woods!

For the 2023 Spring Commencement, deadline to order is March 1, 2024.

The initial cost of a legacy stole is $75, and includes all initial embroidery. Future Legacy names can be embroidered for $20 per name.

Order your Legacy Stole today!

More Information

Questions?

For other questions, please contact Janice Tate at janice.tate@WilliamWoods.edu or call 573.592.1174.

Although commencement is not a required activity, William Woods University encourages you to participate. Commencement marks a very important step in life as an occasion of celebration and achievement. You have worked very hard, and this ceremony gives the university the opportunity to congratulate you.
